Founder of the Gurjara-Pratihara Dynasty

Nagabhata I laid the true foundation of the Gurjara-Pratihara dynasty in the Malwa region (Avanti). He was known as the protector of Kshatriyas and Brahmins. The Gwalior inscription mentions him as an incarnation of 'Narayana'.

ЁЯЫбя╕П
Defense Against Arab Invasions

His greatest historical achievement was stopping the invasion of the Arab rulers (Mlecchas) of Sindh. He defeated the Arab army led by Junaid, making him one of the key rulers who stopped the spread of Islam in Indian history.

ЁЯПЩя╕П
Capital

He established his capital in Ujjain (Avanti), which was a major cultural and political center at that time.
